questions.question: At the beginning of the selection, why is Maya frightened?

choices.answer: She is traveling on a train for the first time
She is traveling to a large city where she has never been
She does not want to meet her mother, who abandoned her
She does not want to be with her grandmother

questions.question: What is an important lesson Maya learns from her mother as she gets to know her?

choices.answer: People can never change their ways
Being kind to others can be satisfying
Her mother will always love Bailey more
Dancing and singing to music can make you happy

questions.question: Why is Maya upset over Bailey's reaction to meeting their mother?

choices.answer: She feels that he is behaving rudely
She fears she will be ignored because he is devoted to mom
She doubts he can learn to love their mother
She thinks he will anger their mother and be sent away

questions.question: Which statement best describes Maya's attitude about her new life at the end of the story?

choices.answer: She is somewhat willing to give her new family a chance
She is not angry with her mother anymore
She fears Grandmother cannot survive Arkansas without her
She is sure her new life in CA will be better than before

questions.question: How would charitable people react to those who have been rude to them?

choices.answer: a feeling of forgiveness
a desire to be rude to them
a feeling of deep sadness
a desire to shame the rude people

questions.question: When would a 12 year old need supervision?

choices.answer: When practicing piano
When learning how to dive into a pool
When playing a board game
When watching sports on TV

questions.question: If a person is called a philanthropist, which of the following must be true?

choices.answer: The person is extremely selfish
The person must disapprove of most people
The person must want to be famous
The person must want to help people in need

questions.question: What do readers learn about Maya's mother based on how she acts with Maya?

choices.answer: She wishes she had Maya's singing and dancing talents
She fears that she will be a bad influence on Maya
She hopes that Maya will accept her and love her
She demands that Maya immediately accept her as a parent

questions.question: How does Maya feel as she watches her brother, Bailey, greet their mother?

choices.answer: ashamed of how badly she has treated their mother
proud of Bailey for not being angry at their mother
jealous that Bailey will now be mother's favorite child
betrayed because he has so easily forgiven their mother

questions.question: After Bailey arrives, how does Grandmother feel after she talks with Maya?

choices.answer: She decides to stay in San Francisco with the new family
She sympathizes with Maya and offers to take her home to Ark
She wants to get rid of Maya and Bailey and go home
She understands Maya's feelings about Bailey and her mom

questions.question: Even though she isn't a philanthropist she wants to be charitable. What does this say about her

choices.answer: It shows that she judges other people harshly
it indicates that she tries to be kind and forgiving
it explains why she donates money to charity
It emphasizes the differences between rich and poor people

questions.question: Her mother watched Maya for 2 weeks without saying much. What character trait does this show?

choices.answer: pushy
talented
patient
beautiful

questions.question: One meaning of the Latin prefix super- is

choices.answer: under
toward
above
between

questions.question: Natural means "existing in nature." Use this info to define supernatural

choices.answer: something existing near nature
something beyond what exists in nature
something existing within nature
something similar to what exists in nature
their mother had sent them to Grandmother's home
after living in San Francisco for ten years
because she could not care for them herself
a place she had never been before
Maya did not recognize her mom
the mother was thrilled to see her
when she first saw her at the station
she did not know how to respond

questions.question: In the video, how do Maya's feelings about her mother differ from her feelings in the story?

choices.answer: She has learned to love and appreciate her mom's kind nature
She has become famous and no longer thinks about her mother
She has forgiven her mother but still does not love her
She regrets not leaving her mother and returning to Arkansas

questions.question: How is the video interview with Maya different from the story?

choices.answer: only the video provides facts about her life
only the video includes questions and her facial expressions
only the video provides insights into her feelings
only the video shows info about her relationship w/ her mom

questions.question: What topic is mentioned in the video, but not addressed in the story?

choices.answer: forgiveness
family
patience
race
